comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I don't think the ANZAC War Memorial in Hyde Park, Sydney is ever referred to as the "Shrine of Remembrance". The poplar trees around the Pool of Remembrance look a little bit less ragged than in the 1934 photo by Harold Cazneaux, when the Memorial was opened - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn3563305 . So maybe this photo is c.1935? The finest art deco structure in Australia? - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANZAC_War_Memorial

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: For sure, it is never referred to as the Shrine of Remembrance these days, but is was once. For example, see this Frank Hurley view, circa 1940: nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an23381817 But there is no mention of that name at the official website here: www.anzacmemorial.nsw.gov.au/home

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Anyone who calls it that,  is surely from Melbourne.
